gov.usgs.adslserver

Class ADSLRequestHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.adslserver.ADSLRequestHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ADSLRequestHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    this class handles a single socket connection to the thread. It is a pool thread so it is created, and waits to be assigned a socket. It runs until that socket is closed or potentially timed out by the pool management in the outer class

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.lang.Thread

    • Constructor Detail

      • ADSLRequestHandler

        public ADSLRequestHandler(java.net.Socket ss,
                  EdgeThread parent)
        create a socket handler. If ss is not null, the socket will start handling right away
        Parameters:
        ss - A socket to use on creation, null to set up a waiting pool socket
        parent - The EdgeThread to use for logging.

      • assignSocket

        public void assignSocket(java.net.Socket ss,
                java.lang.String line)
        assign a socket to this handler for processing, optionally, submit an existing line to bypass input from socket
        Parameters:
        ss - the socket to attach
        line - If not null, process this as if it was read from the socket

      • getSocket

        public java.net.Socket getSocket()
        return the socket open on this thread. If null, then no socket is assigned.
        Returns:
        The open socket or null if not assigned.
